sen.j: 惟宗 康友（これむね やすとも、別名藤内康友・鹿児島康友）は、日本の鎌倉時代の御家人。
sen.e: Yasutomo KOREMUNE (another name: Yasutomo TONAI/Yasutomo KAGOSHIMA) was a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) in Kamakura period in Japan.

sen.cmt: 別名は２つ挙げられているのでanother names としました。 また「御家人」の説明に複数の時代が言及されているのが紛らわしく後に続く「鎌倉時代」を考慮して冗長に思えましたので削除しました。

sen.j: 藤内内舎人・馬寮・大夫日本における大夫四等官・鹿児島郡司并弁済使職。
sen.e: He filled posts of Tonai udoneri (Ministerial equerry), Meryo (the section taking care of imperial horses), daibu (master) Shitokan (fourth rank) of 大夫日本 and Kagoshima Gunji (local magistrates) as well as Benzaishi (official collecting kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes) and somai (rice)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「大夫日本」の読みが不明です。
sen.e: He served as Tonai udoneri (ministerial equerry appointed by the Fujiwara clan), an official at Meryo (the section taking care of imperial horses), daibu (master) of Shitokan (four classifications of bureaucrats' ranks) of 大夫日本 and Gunji (local magistrate) for Kagoshima doubling as Benzaishi (official collecting kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes) and somai (rice)).
sen.cmt: 大夫四等官はfourth rank ではないようです。地位を訳出するなら４つのうちの最上位のようです。ここでは４つのランクのなかの大夫という職よいう意味に書き換えました。なお、「大夫日本...」は誤記のようです。

sen.e: Also he referred himself as the Kagoshima clan, and was a gokenin of Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and filled posts of Kinri (the Imperial Palace) Shuin in Nitta-jinja Shrine in Satsuma Province (Satsumasendai City) as well as Inju (the chief of a temple) in Godai-in temple in Bunji era.

sen.j: また 鹿児島は島津荘(摂関家であった近衛家領荘園)内で、また 康友は藤内内舎人である事から、摂関家との関係も考慮する必要があると思われる。
sen.e: Also he was in Shimazu-no-sho estate (a private estate of the Konoe family that was a Sekke) in Kagoshima and Yasutomo was also an udoneri of Tonai, therefore relationship between Sekke must also be considered.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also, relationship between the Koremune clan and Sekkan-ke (families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor) must also be considered from the facts that Kagoshima was in Shimazu-no-sho estate (a private estate of the Konoe family that was a Sekkan-ke) and that Yasutomo was Tonai udoneri appointed by the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 「島津荘内「にあったのはheではなく「鹿児島」という地であるととらえ前文書き換えました。また後半も何と「摂関家」の関係なのかわかりにくいと思われましたので明確になるよう書き換えました。
sen.e: Also, relationship between the Koremune clan and Sekkan-ke (families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor) must also be considered from the facts that Kagoshima was in Shimazu-no-sho estate (a private estate of the Konoe family that was a Sekkan-ke) and that Yasutomo was Tonai udoneri appointed by the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 建仁3年12月、島津荘寄郡鹿児島郡司弁済使職の意見に対し、鎌倉幕府から相伝の道理に基づき守護所に裁決された。
sen.e: In December 1203, for an opinion of Benzaishi in Gunji of Shimazu-no-sho estate yosegori (the donation of koryo (an imperial demesne)), Kagoshima, he was appointed to shugosho based on principle of hereditary succession by Kamakura bakufu.

In December 1203, in respect of arguments over the posts of Gunji and Benzaishi for Kagoshima of yosegori (lands donated to the lord) in Shimazu-no-sho estate (manor), the Kamakura bakufu ordered shugosho (provincial administrative office) to make a decision based on the principle of hereditary succession.

sen.j: 惟宗姓である事から秦氏の後裔であり、忠を通字とする惟宗氏に皇別の聖武天皇説・醍醐天皇説の二流がある。
sen.e: There are two theories, which are Emperor Shomu theory and Emperor Daigo theory, for Koremune clan that uses tsuji (distinctive character used in the names of all people belonging to a single clan or lineage) of '忠' (reads; tada, kiyoshi, chu, kiyo, tata, etc) and is thought to be the descendant of Hata clan and Koremune clan, as his family name was Koremune.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Family name Koremune implies that the Koremune clan descended from the Hata clan and in respect of the members of the clan whose names included a kanji letter "忠" (meaning "faith") as tsuji (distinctive character used in the names of all people belonging to a single clan or lineage), there are two explanations, one is that they were from families branched out from Emperor Shomu and the other is that they were from families branched out from Emperor Daigo.
sen.cmt: 意味全体が取れていないようでしたので全文書き換えとしました。
sen.e: The Family name Koremune implies that the Koremune clan descended from the Hata clan and in respect of the members of the clan whose names included a kanji letter "忠" (meaning "faith") as tsuji (distinctive character used in the names of all people belonging to a single clan or lineage), there are two explanations, one is that they were from families branched out from Emperor Shomu and the other is that they were from families branched out from Emperor Daigo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 康友の子孫の執印氏や国分氏 (薩摩国)は醍醐天皇後裔説の、醍醐天皇―保明親王―慶頼王―惟宗具瞻としている。
sen.e: Shuin clan and Kokubun clan (Satsuma Province), who are descendants of Yasutomo, are fitted to theory of Emperor Daigo descendant, which follows; Emperor Daigo - Imperial Prince Yasuakira - Prince Yoshiyori - Gusen KOREMUNE.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Shuin clan and the Kokubun clan (Satsuma Province), who were descendants of Yasutomo, are thought to be descendants of Emperor Daigo, from whom Imperial Prince Yasuakira, Prince Yoshiyori and Gusen KOREMUNE descended in this order.
sen.cmt: 冠詞の抜け（theory の前）、名詞の単複の間違い(descendant)、その他文の構成等を考え、全文書き換えとしました。具瞻:読み方未確認
sen.e: The Shuin clan and the Kokubun clan (Satsuma Province), who were descendants of Yasutomo, are thought to be descendants of Emperor Daigo, from whom Imperial Prince Yasuakira, Prince Yoshiyori and Gusen KOREMUNE descended in this order.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
